error.signature: Warning: Text content did not match. Server: 'X' Client: 'Y'
error.regex: Text content did not match|Hydration failed.*text content

verdict.summary: SSR hydration mismatch. Server and client render different text. Common: dates, random values, browser APIs.

dead_ends.why_fails: Hides the warning but the mismatch still causes visual flicker
Loses SEO and initial load performance

workarounds.action: Use useEffect for browser-only values (dates, localStorage, window size)
workarounds.how:
const [time, setTime] = useState('');
useEffect(() => setTime(new Date().toLocaleString()), []);

workarounds.action: Use suppressHydrationWarning only on the specific element with dynamic content
Ensure server and client use the same data â€” pass SSR data via props, not new fetches

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Both produce similar messages, but 'text-content-mismatch' and 'useeffect-cleanup-memory-leak' differ in root cause and environment context.
'Warning' indicates server/client HTML text mismatch (hydration), while 'Invalid hook call. Hooks can only be called inside the body of a function compon' indicates a React hooks rules violation.
